body.p: oXygen WebApp uses a floating license model, where the license key is stored on a server and individual users consume license seats from a common pool.

section.title: How it works
section.p: The license key contains the maximum number of users that can simultaneously access the WebApp at any given moment. After a period of inactivity, the license allocated to that user becomes available.

While no personal information is sent to the server, a cookie that identifies the user is auto-generated. Note that the use of two different browsers (for example, Firefox and Chrome) by a single user, will consume two floating licenses. However, using two or more windows or tabs of the same browser, consumes a single floating license.

section.title: Licensing
section.p: Follow these steps to license a deployment of oXygen XML Author WebApp:

ol.li: To obtain a license key, please contact support@oxygenxml.com.
Paste the license key in a file called license.txt and save it in the WEB-INF folder of the oXygen XML Author WebApp deployment.
